intro: Sairocarpus nuttallianus, commonly known as the Nuttall's sairocarpus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late spring. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a subtle, spicy scent. Sairocarpus nuttallianus is typically found in moist, woodland habitats and is relatively uncommon in the wild.
